messages.title: Labour will rebuild Britain for the many not the few
messages.content: After 9 years of cuts from the Coalition and Tory Governments, it’s time for real change in Britain. A Labour government will invest in our cash-strapped public services to support everyone in society.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Investment in our NHS, schools and police
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour promises to invest in critical public services.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A Final Say vote on Brexit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Offering the option to remain in the EU.
Tackling the climate crisis through sustainable industrial policies.
Ending homelessness and ensuring everyone has a place to live.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Vote Lib Dem - get Tory - You can’t trust the Lib Dems to stand up for working people. Lib Dem leader Jo Swinson helped the Conservatives slash public services as part of the coalition government. She voted with the Tories 849 times between 2010-2015; that’s more times than 72 actual Tory MPs!

issues.brexitEurope: A Final Say vote on Brexit - with the option to remain
issues.environment: A Green Industrial Strategy to tackle the climate crisis

community.content: Jeff is always available to support local community groups and is a familiar face at local schools and community events.

endorsements.endorsement: Jeff has lived locally all his life and is committed to South Manchester. He is always available to support local community groups and is a familiar face at local schools and community events.

As a former headteacher, and now school governor with him, the thing I see in Jeff and I enjoy working with him on most is his commitment to giving young people the very best start in life. Labour’s National Education Service will make sure every young person has the best teaching possible from Sustrans to adulthood.

examples: Jo Swinson voted with the Tories 849 times between 2010-2015; that’s more times than 72 actual Tory MPs!
